oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Evaluation of Two Chute-Side Tests for the Detection of Leukocytes and Bacteria in Semen from Yearling Bulls
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hiew, M. W. H.
Horstman, L. A.
Singleton, W. L.
Messick, J. B.
Constable, P. D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: leukocytes
semen
chute-side tests
leukospermia
bacteriospermia
esterases
somatic cells
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The presence of leukocytes in semen causes bulls to potentially be unsatisfactory breeders. Multistix® 10 SG Reagent Strips (Bayer Healthcare, Elkhart, IN) and the Uriscreen™ catalase test (Jant Pharmacal Corporation, Encino, CA) were used to evaluate their possibility to serve as chute-side tests to detect leukospermia and bacteriospermia in yearling bulls. The reagent strips detect esterases produced by granulocytes, whereas the catalase test reportedly detects the presence of somatic cells (> 10 cells per high power field) or bacteria (>5 x 104 CFU/ml).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2011; 164
